author: Special Correspondent
text:
Helmet awareness rally was taken out in Ramanathapuram on Wednesday.— Photo: L. Balachandar

Collector K. Nanthakumar flagged of a helmet awareness rally here on Wednesday as part of the Road Safety Week celebrations, which began on Sunday.

About 400 people, including policemen, general public and college students, took part in the rally held from Collectorate to the Regional Transport Office (RTO) through busy thoroughfares, conveying the message of road safety and the need for helmet wearing.

Transport Joint Commissioner B. Muruganandam, Additional Superintendent of Police (Headquarters) Inbamani, Assistant Superintendent of Police S. Sarvesh Raj, Regional Transport Officer J. Sheik Mohamed, RTO Inspectors Ashok Kumar and Manickam, and Traffic Inspector of Police Muthuramalingam were among others participated in the event.

A majority of two-wheeler riders started wearing helmets after Superintendent of Police N. Manivannan launched a special helmet wearing drive in the district.

On Tuesday, the Transport department organised essay writing and drawing competitions for schoolchildren on road safety and this year’s theme of “Road safety – Time for Action”.
title: Helmet awareness rally flagged off
